intro: Ilysanthes schweinfurthii var. linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ilysanthes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that give it its varietal name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
